5#ifndef V8_HEAP_MEMORY_CHUNK_H_
6#define V8_HEAP_MEMORY_CHUNK_H_
7
8#include "src/base/build_config.h"
9#include "src/base/functional.h"
10#include "src/flags/flags.h"
11
12#if V8_ENABLE_STICKY_MARK_BITS_BOOL
13#define UNREACHABLE_WITH_STICKY_MARK_BITS() UNREACHABLE()
14#else
15#define UNREACHABLE_WITH_STICKY_MARK_BITS()
16#endif
17
18namespace v8 {
19namespace internal {
20
21class Heap;
22class MemoryChunkMetadata;
23class ReadOnlyPageMetadata;
24class PageMetadata;
25class LargePageMetadata;
26class CodeStubAssembler;
27class ExternalReference;
28template <typename T>
29class Tagged;
30
31enum class MarkingMode { kNoMarking, kMinorMarking, kMajorMarking };
32
33class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE MemoryChunk final {
34 public:
35 // All possible flags that can be set on a page. While the value of flags
36 // doesn't matter in principle, keep flags used in the write barrier together
37 // in order to have dense page flag checks in the write barrier.
38 enum Flag : uintptr_t {
39 NO_FLAGS = 0u,
40
41 // This page belongs to a shared heap.
42 IN_WRITABLE_SHARED_SPACE = 1u << 0,
43
44 // These two flags are used in the write barrier to catch "interesting"
45 // references.
46 POINTERS_TO_HERE_ARE_INTERESTING = 1u << 1,
47 POINTERS_FROM_HERE_ARE_INTERESTING = 1u << 2,
48
49 // A page in the from-space or a young large page that was not scavenged
50 // yet.
51 FROM_PAGE = 1u << 3,
52 // A page in the to-space or a young large page that was scavenged.
53 TO_PAGE = 1u << 4,
54
55 // |INCREMENTAL_MARKING|: Indicates whether incremental marking is currently
56 // enabled.
57 INCREMENTAL_MARKING = 1u << 5,
58
59 // The memory chunk belongs to the read-only heap and does not participate
60 // in garbage collection. This is used instead of owner for identity
61 // checking since read-only chunks have no owner once they are detached.
62 READ_ONLY_HEAP = 1u << 6,
63
64 // ----------------------------------------------------------------
65 // Values below here are not critical for the heap write barrier.
66
67 LARGE_PAGE = 1u << 7,
68 EVACUATION_CANDIDATE = 1u << 8,
69 NEVER_EVACUATE = 1u << 9,
70
71 // |PAGE_NEW_OLD_PROMOTION|: A page tagged with this flag has been promoted
72 // from new to old space during evacuation.
73 PAGE_NEW_OLD_PROMOTION = 1u << 10,
74
75 // This flag is intended to be used for testing. Works only when both
76 // v8_flags.stress_compaction and
77 // v8_flags.manual_evacuation_candidates_selection are set. It forces the
78 // page to become an evacuation candidate at next candidates selection
79 // cycle.
80 FORCE_EVACUATION_CANDIDATE_FOR_TESTING = 1u << 11,
81
82 // This flag is intended to be used for testing.
83 NEVER_ALLOCATE_ON_PAGE = 1u << 12,
84
85 // The memory chunk is already logically freed, however the actual freeing
86 // still has to be performed.
87 PRE_FREED = 1u << 13,
88
89 // |COMPACTION_WAS_ABORTED|: Indicates that the compaction in this page
90 // has been aborted and needs special handling by the sweeper.
91 COMPACTION_WAS_ABORTED = 1u << 14,
92
93 NEW_SPACE_BELOW_AGE_MARK = 1u << 15,
94
95 // The memory chunk freeing bookkeeping has been performed but the chunk has
96 // not yet been freed.
97 UNREGISTERED = 1u << 16,
98
99 // The memory chunk is pinned in memory and can't be moved. This is likely
100 // because there exists a potential pointer to somewhere in the chunk which
101 // can't be updated.
102 PINNED = 1u << 17,
103
104 // A Page with code objects.
105 IS_EXECUTABLE = 1u << 18,
106
107 // The memory chunk belongs to the trusted space. When the sandbox is
108 // enabled, the trusted space is located outside of the sandbox and so its
109 // content cannot be corrupted by an attacker.
110 IS_TRUSTED = 1u << 19,
111
112 // Used in young generation checks. When sticky mark-bits are enabled and
113 // major GC in progress, treat all objects as old.
114 IS_MAJOR_GC_IN_PROGRESS = 1u << 20,
115 };
116
117 using MainThreadFlags = base::Flags<Flag, uintptr_t>;
118
119 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kAllFlagsMask = ~MainThreadFlags(NO_FLAGS);
120 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kPointersToHereAreInterestingMask =
121 POINTERS_TO_HERE_ARE_INTERESTING;
122 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kPointersFromHereAreInterestingMask =
123 POINTERS_FROM_HERE_ARE_INTERESTING;
124 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kEvacuationCandidateMask =
125 EVACUATION_CANDIDATE;
126 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kIsInYoungGenerationMask =
127 MainThreadFlags(FROM_PAGE) | MainThreadFlags(TO_PAGE);
128 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kIsInReadOnlyHeapMask = READ_ONLY_HEAP;
129 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kIsLargePageMask = LARGE_PAGE;
130 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kInSharedHeap = IN_WRITABLE_SHARED_SPACE;
131 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kIncrementalMarking = INCREMENTAL_MARKING;
132 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kSkipEvacuationSlotsRecordingMask =
133 MainThreadFlags(kEvacuationCandidateMask) |
134 MainThreadFlags(kIsInYoungGenerationMask);
135
136 // Page flags copied from from-space to to-space when flipping semispaces.
137 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kCopyOnFlipFlagsMask =
138 MainThreadFlags(POINTERS_TO_HERE_ARE_INTERESTING) |
139 MainThreadFlags(POINTERS_FROM_HERE_ARE_INTERESTING) |
140 MainThreadFlags(INCREMENTAL_MARKING);
141
142 static constexpr MainThreadFlags kIsInReadOnlyHeapOrMajorGCInProgressMask =
143 kIsInReadOnlyHeapMask | IS_MAJOR_GC_IN_PROGRESS;
144
145 MemoryChunk(MainThreadFlags flags, MemoryChunkMetadata* metadata);
146
147 V8_INLINE Address address() const { return reinterpret_cast<Address>(this); }
148
149 static constexpr Address BaseAddress(Address a) {
150 // If this changes, we also need to update
151 // CodeStubAssembler::MemoryChunkFromAddress and
152 // MacroAssembler::MemoryChunkHeaderFromObject
153 return a & ~kAlignmentMask;
154 }
155
156 V8_INLINE static MemoryChunk* FromAddress(Address addr) {
157 DCHECK(!V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL);
158 return reinterpret_cast<MemoryChunk*>(BaseAddress(addr));
159 }
160
161 template <typename HeapObject>
162 V8_INLINE static MemoryChunk* FromHeapObject(Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
163 DCHECK(!V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL);
164 return FromAddress(object.ptr());
165 }
166
167 V8_INLINE MemoryChunkMetadata* Metadata();
168
169 V8_INLINE const MemoryChunkMetadata* Metadata() const;
170
171 V8_INLINE bool IsFlagSet(Flag flag) const {
172 return main_thread_flags_ & flag;
173 }
174
175 V8_INLINE bool IsMarking() const { return IsFlagSet(INCREMENTAL_MARKING); }
176
177 V8_INLINE bool InWritableSharedSpace() const {
178 return IsFlagSet(IN_WRITABLE_SHARED_SPACE);
179 }
180
181 V8_INLINE bool InYoungGeneration() const {
182 UNREACHABLE_WITH_STICKY_MARK_BITS();
183 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) return false;
184 constexpr uintptr_t kYoungGenerationMask = FROM_PAGE | TO_PAGE;
185 return GetFlags() & kYoungGenerationMask;
186 }
187
188 // Checks whether chunk is either in young gen or shared heap.
189 V8_INLINE bool IsYoungOrSharedChunk() const {
190 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL) return false;
191 constexpr uintptr_t kYoungOrSharedChunkMask =
192 FROM_PAGE | TO_PAGE | IN_WRITABLE_SHARED_SPACE;
193 return GetFlags() & kYoungOrSharedChunkMask;
194 }
195
196 void SetFlagSlow(Flag flag);
197 void ClearFlagSlow(Flag flag);
198
199 V8_INLINE MainThreadFlags GetFlags() const { return main_thread_flags_; }
200
201 V8_INLINE void SetFlagUnlocked(Flag flag) { main_thread_flags_ |= flag; }
202 V8_INLINE void ClearFlagUnlocked(Flag flag) {
203 main_thread_flags_ = main_thread_flags_.without(flag);
204 }
205 // Set or clear multiple flags at a time. `mask` indicates which flags are
206 // should be replaced with new `flags`.
207 V8_INLINE void ClearFlagsUnlocked(MainThreadFlags flags) {
208 main_thread_flags_ &= ~flags;
209 }
210 V8_INLINE void SetFlagsUnlocked(MainThreadFlags flags,
211 MainThreadFlags mask = kAllFlagsMask) {
212 main_thread_flags_ = (main_thread_flags_ & ~mask) | (flags & mask);
213 }
214
215 V8_INLINE void SetFlagNonExecutable(Flag flag) {
216 return SetFlagUnlocked(flag);
217 }
218 V8_INLINE void ClearFlagNonExecutable(Flag flag) {
219 return ClearFlagUnlocked(flag);
220 }
221 V8_INLINE void SetFlagsNonExecutable(MainThreadFlags flags,
222 MainThreadFlags mask = kAllFlagsMask) {
223 return SetFlagsUnlocked(flags, mask);
224 }
225 V8_INLINE void ClearFlagsNonExecutable(MainThreadFlags flags) {
226 return ClearFlagsUnlocked(flags);
227 }
228 V8_INLINE void SetMajorGCInProgress() {
229 SetFlagUnlocked(IS_MAJOR_GC_IN_PROGRESS);
230 }
231 V8_INLINE void ResetMajorGCInProgress() {
232 ClearFlagUnlocked(IS_MAJOR_GC_IN_PROGRESS);
233 }
234
235 V8_INLINE Heap* GetHeap();
236
237 // Emits a memory barrier. For TSAN builds the other thread needs to perform
238 // MemoryChunk::SynchronizedLoad() to simulate the barrier.
239 void InitializationMemoryFence();
240
241#ifdef THREAD_SANITIZER
242 void SynchronizedLoad() const;
243 bool InReadOnlySpace() const;
244#else
245 V8_INLINE bool InReadOnlySpace() const { return IsFlagSet(READ_ONLY_HEAP); }
246#endif
247
248 V8_INLINE bool InCodeSpace() const { return IsFlagSet(IS_EXECUTABLE); }
249
250 V8_INLINE bool InTrustedSpace() const { return IsFlagSet(IS_TRUSTED); }
251
252 bool NeverEvacuate() const { return IsFlagSet(NEVER_EVACUATE); }
253 void MarkNeverEvacuate() { SetFlagSlow(NEVER_EVACUATE); }
254
255 bool CanAllocate() const {
256 return !IsEvacuationCandidate() && !IsFlagSet(NEVER_ALLOCATE_ON_PAGE);
257 }
258
259 bool IsEvacuationCandidate() const {
260 DCHECK(!(IsFlagSet(NEVER_EVACUATE) && IsFlagSet(EVACUATION_CANDIDATE)));
261 return IsFlagSet(EVACUATION_CANDIDATE);
262 }
263
264 bool ShouldSkipEvacuationSlotRecording() const {
265 MainThreadFlags flags = GetFlags();
266 return ((flags & kSkipEvacuationSlotsRecordingMask) != 0) &&
267 ((flags & COMPACTION_WAS_ABORTED) == 0);
268 }
269
270 Executability executable() const {
271 return IsFlagSet(IS_EXECUTABLE) ? EXECUTABLE : NOT_EXECUTABLE;
272 }
273
274 bool IsFromPage() const {
275 UNREACHABLE_WITH_STICKY_MARK_BITS();
276 return IsFlagSet(FROM_PAGE);
277 }
278 bool IsToPage() const {
279 UNREACHABLE_WITH_STICKY_MARK_BITS();
280 return IsFlagSet(TO_PAGE);
281 }
282 bool IsLargePage() const { return IsFlagSet(LARGE_PAGE); }
283 bool InNewSpace() const { return InYoungGeneration() && !IsLargePage(); }
284 bool InNewLargeObjectSpace() const {
285 return InYoungGeneration() && IsLargePage();
286 }
287 bool IsPinned() const { return IsFlagSet(PINNED); }
288 bool IsReadOnlyOrMajorMarkingOn() const {
289 return InReadOnlySpace() || IsFlagSet(IS_MAJOR_GC_IN_PROGRESS);
290 }
291
292 V8_INLINE static constexpr bool IsAligned(Address address) {
293 return (address & kAlignmentMask) == 0;
294 }
295
296 static MainThreadFlags OldGenerationPageFlags(MarkingMode marking_mode,
297 bool in_shared_space);
298 static MainThreadFlags YoungGenerationPageFlags(MarkingMode marking_mode);
299
300 void SetOldGenerationPageFlags(MarkingMode marking_mode,
301 bool in_shared_space);
302 void SetYoungGenerationPageFlags(MarkingMode marking_mode);
303
304#ifdef DEBUG
305 bool IsTrusted() const;
306#else
307 bool IsTrusted() const { return IsFlagSet(IS_TRUSTED); }
308#endif
309
310 static intptr_t GetAlignmentForAllocation() { return kAlignment; }
311 // The macro and code stub assemblers need access to the alignment mask to
312 // implement functionality from this class. In particular, this is used to
313 // implement the header lookups and to calculate the object offsets in the
314 // page.
315 static constexpr intptr_t GetAlignmentMaskForAssembler() {
316 return kAlignmentMask;
317 }
318
319 static constexpr uint32_t AddressToOffset(Address address) {
320 return static_cast<uint32_t>(address) & kAlignmentMask;
321 }
322
323#ifdef DEBUG
324 size_t Offset(Address addr) const;
325 // RememberedSetOperations take an offset to an end address that can be behind
326 // the allocated memory.
327 size_t OffsetMaybeOutOfRange(Address addr) const;
328#else
329 size_t Offset(Address addr) const { return addr - address(); }
330 size_t OffsetMaybeOutOfRange(Address addr) const { return Offset(addr); }
331#endif
332
333#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
334 static void ClearMetadataPointer(MemoryChunkMetadata* metadata);
335#endif
336
337 private:
338 // Flags that are only mutable from the main thread when no concurrent
339 // component (e.g. marker, sweeper, compilation, allocation) is running.
340 MainThreadFlags main_thread_flags_;
341
342#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
343 uint32_t metadata_index_;
344#else
345 MemoryChunkMetadata* metadata_;
346#endif
347
348 static constexpr intptr_t kAlignment =
349 (static_cast<uintptr_t>(1) << kPageSizeBits);
350 static constexpr intptr_t kAlignmentMask = kAlignment - 1;
351
352#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
353#ifndef V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
354#error The global metadata pointer table requires a single external code space.
355#endif
356#ifdef V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP
357#error The global metadata pointer table is incompatible with third party heap.
358#endif
359
360 static constexpr size_t kPagesInMainCage =
361 kPtrComprCageReservationSize / kRegularPageSize;
362 static constexpr size_t kPagesInCodeCage =
363 kMaximalCodeRangeSize / kRegularPageSize;
364 static constexpr size_t kPagesInTrustedCage =
365 kMaximalTrustedRangeSize / kRegularPageSize;
366
367 static constexpr size_t kMainCageMetadataOffset = 0;
368 static constexpr size_t kTrustedSpaceMetadataOffset =
369 kMainCageMetadataOffset + kPagesInMainCage;
370 static constexpr size_t kCodeRangeMetadataOffset =
371 kTrustedSpaceMetadataOffset + kPagesInTrustedCage;
372
373 static constexpr size_t kMetadataPointerTableSizeLog2 = base::bits::BitWidth(
374 kPagesInMainCage + kPagesInCodeCage + kPagesInTrustedCage);
375 static constexpr size_t kMetadataPointerTableSize =
376 1 << kMetadataPointerTableSizeLog2;
377 static constexpr size_t kMetadataPointerTableSizeMask =
378 kMetadataPointerTableSize - 1;
379
380 static MemoryChunkMetadata*
381 metadata_pointer_table_[kMetadataPointerTableSize];
382
383 V8_INLINE static MemoryChunkMetadata* FromIndex(uint32_t index);
384 static uint32_t MetadataTableIndex(Address chunk_address);
385
386 V8_INLINE static Address MetadataTableAddress() {
387 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(metadata_pointer_table_);
388 }
389
390 // For access to the kMetadataPointerTableSizeMask;
391 friend class CodeStubAssembler;
392 friend class MacroAssembler;
393 // For access to the MetadataTableAddress;
394 friend class ExternalReference;
395
396#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
397
398 friend class BasicMemoryChunkValidator;
399};
400
401DEFINE_OPERATORS_FOR_FLAGS(MemoryChunk::MainThreadFlags)
402
403} // namespace internal
404
405namespace base {
406
407// Define special hash function for chunk pointers, to be used with std data
408// structures, e.g.
409// std::unordered_set<MemoryChunk*, base::hash<MemoryChunk*>
410// This hash function discards the trailing zero bits (chunk alignment).
411// Notice that, when pointer compression is enabled, it also discards the
412// cage base.
413template <>
414struct hash<const i::MemoryChunk*> {
415 V8_INLINE size_t operator()(const i::MemoryChunk* chunk) const {
416 return static_cast<v8::internal::Tagged_t>(
417 reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(chunk)) >>
418 kPageSizeBits;
419 }
420};
421
422template <>
423struct hash<i::MemoryChunk*> {
424 V8_INLINE size_t operator()(i::MemoryChunk* chunk) const {
425 return hash<const i::MemoryChunk*>()(chunk);
426 }
427};
428
429} // namespace base
430
431} // namespace v8
432
433#undef UNREACHABLE_WITH_STICKY_MARK_BITS
